If you use extensively OpenElectrophy, you can:

    * cite this paper, in your publication http://www.frontiersin.org/neuroinformatics/paper/10.3389/neuro.11/014.2009/
    * help the project (by writing documentation, coding new methods, bug tracking, IO coding ...)
    * say thank you to authors
    * pay a glass of wine to authors in a congress
    * make advertising for OpenElectrophy
    * ask our boss (CNRS) to promote us
